page.title: 08TOURISM
page.content: Going north up from the Kessock Bridge,you will reach the Black Isle Peninsula.The Centre is to your left. From there the steps wind down to North Kessock. Here is all you want to know about touring the north.If you call in summer you might meet a bus load of people speaking German,French,Italian or even Japanese.Here tourists can book rooms or find out where to buy craftwork.All events,like Highland Games,are advertised on leaflets.You can buy maps and souvenirs. Seven busy ladies work here in summer and three in winter.They answer 36000 enquiries a year.At the old Muir of Ord office,before the bridge was built only 3000 were answered. There is a big picnic area where you can enjoy(or photograph)a lovely view of Inverness and the Firth.
